sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the Inclusion of Women and
Minorities in Clinical Research Act.

sections.heading: Exceptions.
sections.text:
The requirements established in Sections 10 and 25
regarding women and members of minority groups do not apply to a project of
clinical
research if the inclusion of women and members of minority groups as subjects
in the
project is inappropriate because of either of the following:

sections.heading: Manner of conducting trial.
sections.text:
In a clinical trial in which women
or
members of minority groups will be included as subjects as required under
Section 10, a
grantee must ensure that the trial is designed and carried out in a manner
sufficient to
provide for a valid analysis of whether the variables being studied in the
trial affect
women or members of minority groups, as the case may be, differently than other
subjects in the trial.

sections.heading: Grantee bound by terms of Act.
sections.text:
In any grant, or in any contract
by
a
grantee under a grant, the grantee or contracting party must acknowledge, agree
to, and be
bound by the terms of this Act.

sections.heading: Grantee's compliance with 2000 National Institutes of Health
sections.text:
guidelines. If a grantee is in compliance with the 2000 National Institutes of
Health
guidelines, the grantee shall be deemed to be in compliance with this Act.
